result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L. McCabe

records.addlTxt: for comp eval

10:29 AM Defendant Michael L. McCabe appeared by phone.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Michael L. McCabe.  Attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Court cites history of case noting change in counsel.  Court questions Atty Hayes re: request for competency hearing.  Atty Hayes responds.  State takes no position.  Court orders competency evaluation to be completed.  Court does find probable cause after reviewing the complaint.  DE states he has moved and provides new phone number but has no address to provide.  Atty Hayes believes the phone number is the only way to contact the DE but will reach out to him to find out if there is an address that could be used.  Court advises DE re: the person to contact him re: doing the comp eval.  Eval expected to be completed in about 60 days and then the Court will have a TSC set.  State questions whether the eval would be inpatient or outpatient.  Court would proceed as outpatient unless the evaluator thinks it needs to be inpatient.  Bond continued.

Atty Getsinger is making a special appearance.  DE qualified for public defender representation this morning.  Atty Getsinger advises DE wishes to waive time limits.  Matter reset. records.addlTxt: NOH; Pre-Lim 02/24/2022
Preliminary hearing on February 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

03:05 PM Defendant Michael L. McCabe in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Defendant Michael L. McCabe in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael L. McCabe appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  DE does not qualify for PD appt.  New address provided for DE.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  State makes bail argument - requests $2,000 cash w/conditions.  Atty Dolch responds.  Time limits NOT waived for preliminary hearing.  $1,000.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Not to be present at SCDHS in Reedsburg w/o a scheduled appointment and no possession of any firearms.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
